explanation: The code in process_long_param uses memcmp to compare the null-terminated parameter string param against string literals (e.g. memcmp(param, "version", MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_("version"))). MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 explicitly forbids using memcmp to compare null-terminated strings. The presence of those memcmp calls (even when accompanied by a length check) is a violation. Note: the function process_param__medium itself does not call memcmp — the offending calls are in process_long_param — but the reported rule violation is correct for the supplied code base. Use strcmp/strncmp (or another dedicated string comparison) instead.
